quizzes.question: If there is an element with a float property, which neighbor elements will be affected?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Clearing the Float[/h1] Elements that come after the floating element will flow around it. To avoid this, use the clear property. The [b]clear [/b]property specifies the sides of an element where other floating elements are not allowed to be. In the example below, if we set the float property to the div, only the paragraph that comes after the div will be wrapped around the image. [b]The HTML: [/b][code format="html" ]This paragraph is above the div element and is not affected by the float right property.

This paragraph comes after the div element and is affected by the float right property.

This paragraph also comes after the div element and is affected by the float right property.

[/code] [b]The CSS:[/b][code format="css" codeId="572"].floating { float: right; }[/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2657" width="100%"]

quizzes.question: The clear property accepts the values none, left, right and:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Using clear[/h1]

Use the values [b]right[/b], [b]left[/b], and [b]both [/b]to specify the sides of an element where other floating elements are not allowed to be. 

[note]The default value is [b]none[/b], which allows floating elements on both sides.[/note]

quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Clearing Floats[/h1] [b]both [/b]is used to clear floats coming from either direction. [b]The HTML:[/b][code format="html" ]This paragraph is above the div element and is not affected by the float right property.

This paragraph comes after the div element and is affected by the float right property.

This paragraph is out of the floating group and is not affected by the float right property.

[/code] [b]The CSS:[/b][code format="css" codeId="573"].floating { float: right; } .clearing { [b]clear[/b]: [b]both[/b]; }[/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2658" width="100%"]
